intro: Pimpinella katrajensis, commonly known as Katraj angelica, is a flowering plant native to the western Himalayas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
